name: santa-2025-packing
description: Evolve better Christmas tree packing algorithms

problem.goal: Pack n Christmas tree-shaped polygons into the smallest square box

evaluation.notes: Fitness = 1/(score + 1) to make lower score = higher fitness

optimization_strategies.name: hierarchical_packing
optimization_strategies.description: Solve small groups, then merge clusters
optimization_strategies.hint: Pack 5 trees optimally, then pack groups of 5

optimization_strategies.name: genetic_crossover
optimization_strategies.description: Combine good packings from different runs
optimization_strategies.hint: Keep relative positions of subsets of trees

optimization_strategies.name: constraint_programming
optimization_strategies.description: Use OR-Tools CP-SAT for exact small n solutions
optimization_strategies.hint: Model overlaps as constraints, minimize bounding box

optimization_strategies.name: learned_initialization
optimization_strategies.description: Train model to predict good initial placements
optimization_strategies.hint: Use best solutions as training data for placement heuristics

optimization_strategies.name: tree_shape_exploitation
optimization_strategies.description: Exploit the specific tree polygon shape
optimization_strategies.hint: Trees have concave regions that other trees could fit into

optimization_strategies.name: nfp_optimization
optimization_strategies.description: Use No-Fit Polygons for tighter packing
optimization_strategies.hint: Compute NFP between tree shapes for boundary placement

constraints: No overlaps between trees (strict segment intersection check)
All trees must fit within bounding square
Trees can rotate to any angle (0-360 degrees)
Must validate with python/validate_submission.py before accepting
references: GEN120_RESULTS.md - What we've tried and learned
README.md - Full evolution history and algorithm details
